content.raw:
Cloudsim functionality is conditioned on the availability of AWS machines and the number of people submitting solutions. We are able to get around 60-70 AWS machines at any one time. AWS only has so many machines available, and we have to compete with other people. A single submission of a practice run with 4 robots requires 5 AWS machines. There are 8 teams, each of which can submit 10 simultaneous runs. So, there can easily be a backlog of submission requests waiting for available machines.

I suggest to continue doing local development while your submissions to cloudsim get processed.

Cloudsim functionality is conditioned on the availability of AWS machines and the number of people submitting solutions. We are able to get around 60-70 AWS machines at any one time. AWS only has so many machines available, and we have to compete with other people. A single submission of a practice run with 4 robots requires 5 AWS machines. There are 8 teams, each of which can submit 10 simultaneous runs. So, there can easily be a backlog of submission requests waiting for available machines.

I suggest to continue doing local development while your submissions to cloudsim get processed.
